ingredients.name: Extra virgin olive oil (for cilantro sauce)

meals.name: The Turkey Quinoa Veggie Bowl
meals.instruction:
Start by browning turkey meat and set aside. Using the
same pan cook the quinoa. Bring 2 cups water to a boil,
then add quinoa. Simmer for about 15 minutes until all
water is absorbed. When done, remove from heat and keep
covered for about 10 minutes so quinoa can absorb any
excess water.
Preheat oven to 425. In a bowl, toss chickpeas, oil, and
spices until chickpeas are evenly coated. On a baking sheet
lined with parchment paper, bake chickpeas for 15 minutes.
When done, remove from oven and let cool.
To make the cilantro carrot dressing, chop the carrots into
smaller pieces before blending, add all dressing ingredients
to a blender and blend until smooth.
Finally, assemble the bowls. In two bowls, add quinoa, baby
spinach, and chickpeas. Drizzle everything with cilantro
carrot sauce, and sprinkle with sunflower seeds.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Red bell pepper (for a fun and beautiful look, use 1/4 each of orange, yellow, purple, red peppers)

meals.name: One-Pan Roasted Chicken and Veggies
meals.instruction:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Step 2: Chop all the veggies into large cubed pieces,
making sure all sizes are similar.
Step 3: Chop the chicken into cubes.
Step 4: Place the chicken and veggies in a large mixing
bowl. Add the olive oil, salt and pepper, Italian seasoning,
and paprika. Toss to combine.
Step 5: Empty contents from the mixing bowl onto a large
sheet pan, or two if needed.
Step 6: Bake for 15 - 20 minutes or until the veggies are
charred and chicken is cooked through.
Step 7: Enjoy over, or with a side of rice, pasta, quinoa,
etc.

meals.name: High Protein Cottage Cheese & Fruit Snack ( Copy )
meals.instruction:
These two ingredients make for the easiest high protein
snack to keep you feeling satisfied between meals.
Add your choice of fruits for extra fibre and sweetness!

meals.name: Zucchini Chips
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 225 degrees Fahrenheit. Line two large
baking sheets with silicon baking mats or parchment paper.
Slice your zucchini on a mandolin to desired thickness.
After you slice your zucchini, place the slices on a sheet of
paper towels and take another paper towel and sandwich
the zucchini slices and press on them. This helps draw out
the liquid so it will cook a bit faster.
Line up the zucchini slices on the prepared baking sheet
tightly next to each other in a straight line, making sure not
to overlap them.
In a small bowl, pour your olive oil in and take a pastry
brush to brush the olive oil on each zucchini slice.
Sprinkle salt throughout the baking sheet. Be careful not to
over-season, in fact, it's better to use less salt initially
because the slices will shrink.
Bake for 2+ hours until they start to brown and are crisp.
Let cool before removing and serving. Keep in an airtight
container for no more than 3 days.

meals.name: High Protein Cottage Cheese & Fruit Snack ( Copy )
meals.instruction:
These two ingredients make for the easiest high protein
snack to keep you feeling satisfied between meals.
Add your choice of fruits for extra fibre and sweetness!

ingredients.name:
Lime juice (add zest too for more lime
flavour)

meals.name: Cauliflower Tortillas for a Deliciously Happy Bell
meals.instruction:
Preheat the oven to 375�F, put on a pot to steam the
cauliflower in a steam basket, and line a baking sheet with
parchment paper.
Trim the cauliflower, small chunks & then steam them for
2-3 minutes so soft, but not mushy.
Let the cauliflower cool and then pulse it in a food processor
in batches until you get a couscous-like consistency. The
finely riced cauliflower should make about 2 cups packed.
Place the cauliflower Place the cauliflower in a fine
cheesecloth or thin dishtowel and squeeze out as much
liquid as possible,
In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs (or chia egg for vegans).
Add in cauliflower, cilantro, lime, sea salt, and black pepper.
Mix until well combined.
Use your hands to shape six small "tortillas" on the
parchment paper.
Bake for 10 minutes, carefully flip each tortilla and return to
the oven for an additional 5 to 7 minutes, or until
completely set. Place tortillas on a wire rack to cool slightly.
Heat a medium-sized skillet on medium. Place a baked
tortilla in the pan, pressing down slightly, and brown for 1 to
2 minutes on each side. Repeat with remaining tortillas.
Tip: You can munch these by themselves, make quesadillas
with them, or add some taco filling and fold it like a taco

ingredients.name: Ginger root (fresh minced; plus more to taste)

meals.name: Cherry Ginger Joy Smoothie
meals.instruction:
1. Throw all of the ingredients into your blender and
blast on high for 30-60 seconds until smooth and
creamy.

meals.name: Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 450F.
2. Wash, scrub and dry the sweet potatoes.
3. Place a drying rack on top of a cookie sheet and put the
sweet potatoes on top. By baking on a rack, no part of the
skin will get soggy which will make stuffing them easier.
Bake for approximately an hour turning every 20 minutes.
(The sweet potatoes are done when they are soft to the
touch and just starting to puff up, so you can tell the flesh is
shifting away from the skin.)
4. Remove from the oven and let cool enough to handle,
about 15 minutes.
5. Using a sharp knife gently slice away the top third of the
sweet potato. With a small spoon carefully scoop away the
inside of the sweet potato and put the flesh into a medium
bowl.
6. Mash the flesh with a fork and whip in cumin, coriander,
salt and a generous amount of freshly ground pepper. Mix in
the scallions, black beans and lime juice.
7. Divide the mixture in half and carefully stuff back into the
potato skins, you can overfill them as long as they can stay
upright.
8. Place potatoes back on the rack and bake for another 15
minutes.
9. Serve hot and enjoy

meals.name: Handful of Almonds
meals.instruction: A handful of roasted almonds makes the perfect snack.

meals.name: Honey Mustard Turkey Spinach Sandwich
meals.instruction:
Spread the mashed avocado on one side of each slice of
Ezekiel bread. 
Drizzle 1 tbsp of low fat honey mustard dressing.
Place the oven roasted turkey on 1 slice of bread.
Top with spinach, tomato, cucumber and sprouts. 
Close the sandwich, serve and enjoy.

meals.name: Emerald Kale Salad
meals.instruction:
Put chopped kale into a large bowl, drizzle with olive oil and
sprinkle with sea salt.
Massage gently with hands for 5-10 minutes, until the tough
fibers of the kale break down.
Toss with the red onion and cucumber.

meals.name: Spiced Carrot Soup
meals.instruction:
Saut� onion with coconut oil, ginger and turmeric.
Meanwhile, chop carrots into inch thick slices. Add veggie
stock and carrots and bring to a boil. Cover and let simmer
for 5-15 minutes, depending on the thickness of your
carrots. With a fork, test that they are fully cooked through
and remove from heat. Add coconut milk and spices and
blend until smooth.

ingredients.name: Quinoa, cooked (cook with vegetable broth for more flavour)
Leek (finely chopped, light green and white parts only)

meals.name: Butternut, Carrot & Leek Quiche with Quinoa Crust
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 (F). Grease a 9 inch tart pan with coconut oil (or oil of choice).
2. For the crust:
Combine the flax and water in a small bowl and set aside to thicken.
Stir together the cooked quinoa, nutritional yeast, coconut oil, and herbs.
Add the flax mixture and mix until well combined.
Press the mixture into prepared tart pan using your hands.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden.
Turn the oven heat down to 350 (F).
3.For the filling:
In a large pan, heat coconut oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, leeks, carrots, and butternut squash.
Saut�, stirring frequently, until carrots and squash are tender (about 8-10 minutes).
Add spinach and stir until wilted. Remove pan from heat.
In a food processor, combine the remaining ingredients until very smooth.
Transfer creamy mixture to a bowl and stir in saut�ed veggies. Spread the filling over the prepared crust and bake for about
35 minutes (the top should be golden).
Garnish with fresh sage. Allow to cool for at least 10 minutes before slicing.
Enjoy!

5. Line up the zucchini slices on the prepared baking sheet

7. Bake for 2+ hours until they start to brown and are crisp.
8. Let cool before removing and serving. Keep in an airtight
container for no more than 3 days.

meals.name: Flaxseed Paleo Tortilla Chips and Taco Shells
meals.instruction:
Preheat your oven to 175�C/350�F, using a convection
setting if you have one.
Preheat a skillet to medium high heat.
Mix together the flaxseed meal, water, and salt in the
preheated skillet using a spatula to immediately combine
the ingredients and push them together into a dough ball.
The heat of the skillet helps to make the dough less sticky
and more workable, so it's a good idea to use the spatula to
help work the dough in the skillet for around a minute
before forming it into a ball and using it.
With the help of two parchment sheets or sheets of wax
paper, roll the dough into a very thin sheet. Make it as thin
as possible so that it will crisp up quickly in the oven
without getting air bubbles.
Once the dough has been rolled thinly, cut it into tortilla
chip shapes cut the dough into round/oval shapes first and
then use a pizza cutter to cut each circle into 8 triangles.
Bake in the oven for 8-12 minutes, checking the dough
periodically for crispness.
Once crispy, remove from the oven and serve with
guacamole or homemade salsa.

ingredients.name: Bread, sprouted, whole grain, Ezekiel (or gluten-free bread)

meals.name: Open Face Avocado & Tomato Sandwich
meals.instruction: Toast slices of bread. Meanwhile, slice tomato thinly and cut the avocado in half. Mash � the avocado on each piece of toast and arrange tomato slices on top. Grind fresh salt and pepper to taste.

ingredients.name:
Lettuce, romaine (chopped; or baby

meals.name: Blueberry, Almond and Feta Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Combine romaine, blueberries, cucumber, feta and
almonds in a large bowl.
2. Whisk together Dijon mustard, balsamic vinegar,
maple syrup and salt. Slowly pour in olive oil
whisking until completely combined and emulsified.
3. Portion the salad and top with 1�2 tablespoons of
dressing

meals.name: Greek Yogurt with Berries, Nuts and Honey
meals.instruction:
Place yogurt in a dish, top with berries, nuts and honey.
Option to add granola as a topping!

meals.name: Salmon with Roasted Cherry Tomatoes
meals.instruction:
In bowl, combine tomatoes, thyme, garlic, oil and pepper.
Spray baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. Spread
tomato mixture in dish. Bake in 400� F (200� C) oven for 10
minutes.
Add fish; bake for 10 minutes longer or until fish flakes
easily with fork.
Serve fish topped with tomato mixture. Drizzle with lemon
juice.

meals.name: Salmon with Roasted Cherry Tomatoes
meals.instruction:
In bowl, combine tomatoes, thyme, garlic, oil and pepper.
Spray baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. Spread
tomato mixture in dish. Bake in 400� F (200� C) oven for 10
minutes.
Add fish; bake for 10 minutes longer or until fish flakes
easily with fork.
Serve fish topped with tomato mixture. Drizzle with lemon
juice.

ingredients.name: Avocado oil (divided between salmon and veggies)
Garlic powder (to taste, divided between veggies and salmon)

meals.name: One Pan Roasted Salmon and Veggies
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Prepare veggies, add to a bowl and toss in half of the oil
and seasonings.
Add a small amount of oil to the pan where you want to add
salmon and then add salmon to pan, then add the rest of
the oil and seasonings to the top of the salmon.
Place veggies around salmon and place in pre heated oven.
Cook for 20-30 minutes; shaking or flipping vegetables half
way through. Ready to eat out of the oven. Serve on a bed
of your choice of greens or with cauliflower rice or a small
side 1/2 cup or less of rice of choice.

ingredients.name: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F and position a rack in the center of the oven. In a large mixing bowl, combine the coconut, nuts, chia seeds, flax seed, cinnamon, coconut sugar, and salt. In a small saucepan over low heat, warm the coconut oil and pour over the dry ingredients and mix well. Spread the mixture evenly onto a large baking sheet (may require two depending on size) and bake for 20 minutes. Then remove from oven, add roasted sunflower seeds and stir. Increase heat to 340 degrees and return to oven for another 5-8 minutes, or until deep golden brown. The coconut oil will help this granola crisp up nicely, but be sure to watch it carefully as it browns quickly. Once the granola is visibly browned and done cooking (about 27 minutes total for me), remove from the oven and let cool completely. Store in a container with an air-tight seal and it should keep for a few weeks

meals.name: Grain Free Granola Low Carb
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F and position a rack in the
center of the oven.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the coconut, nuts, chia
seeds, flax seed, cinnamon, coconut sugar, and salt.
In a small saucepan over low heat, warm the coconut
oil and pour over the dry ingredients and mix well.
Spread the mixture evenly onto a large baking sheet (may
require two depending on size) and bake for 20 minutes.
Then remove from oven, add roasted sunflower seeds and
stir.
Increase heat to 340 degrees and return to oven for another
5-8 minutes, or until deep golden brown.
The coconut oil will help this granola crisp up nicely, but be
sure to watch it carefully as it browns quickly.
Once the granola is visibly browned and done cooking
(about 27 minutes total for me), remove from the oven and
let cool completely.
Store in a container with an air-tight seal and it should keep
for a few weeks

ingredients.name: Salmon, smoked (see notes for vegan option)

meals.name: Sweet Potato Toast with Smoked Salmon & Guacamole
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 400F degrees.
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
3. Wash sweet potato thoroughly, and then slice into 1/4"
an inch slices (you can use a mandoline slicer). These are
your sweet potato toasts.
4. Coat both sides of sweet potato toasts with olive oil and
lightly sprinkle with sea salt.
5. Bake for 30 minutes (flipping at 20 minutes). At 20
minutes, set oven to broil and continue to cook for 1-2
minutes on each side, until toasty.
6. Remove from oven and set on a plate. Top sweet potato
toasts with guacamole and smoked salmon (check notes for
vegan option).
7. Optional: you can add greens such as arugula, spinach or
sprouts for an extra nutritional boost.

meals.name: Chicken Breast with Shaved Brussels Sprouts
meals.instruction:
Place chicken and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a small saucepan
and cover with water; bring to a boil. Immediately remove
from heat, cover, and let stand 15 minutes. Drain chicken
and run under cold water. Cool completely; set aside. Using
2 forks, shred into bite-size pieces; reserve.
Meanwhile, use a vegetable peeler to remove outer layer of
broccoli stems; discard. Continue peeling stems into long
strips. In a large bowl, whisk together oil, lemon juice, and
1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Add broccoli strips,
Brussels sprouts, celery, hazelnuts, parsley, and reserved
chicken to bowl with dressing; toss. Divide among bowls.
Top with cheese.
Serve and enjoy!

meals.name: Honey Mustard Turkey Spinach Sandwich
meals.instruction:
Spread the mashed avocado on one side of each slice of
Ezekiel bread. 
Drizzle 1 tbsp of low fat honey mustard dressing.
Place the oven roasted turkey on 1 slice of bread.
Top with spinach, tomato, cucumber and sprouts. 
Close the sandwich, serve and enjoy.

meals.name: Nourish Dust
meals.instruction:
Directions: In a high powered blender, grind chia/flax,
sunflower and pumpkin seeds until a fine powder is made.
Add hemp hearts and powder mixture to a mason jar and
store in the fridge for up to 1 month.
Spices to Season: all spice, anise, cardamom, cinnamon,
clove, ginger, nutmeg
Uses: sprinkle on top of an apple with a touch of sea salt
and lemon; add to guacomole, add to smoothies, atop
salads or sprinkle on yogurt/oatmeal/hot cereals!
Note: 1 serving is 1 tablespoon

meals.name: Low-carb blueberry smoothie
meals.instruction:
1. Place all ingredients in a blender and mix until
smooth. Using canned coconut milk makes a
creamier, more satisfying smoothie.
2. Taste, and add more lemon juice if desired.

meals.name: Brain-Adrenal Balancing Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Combine everything in a blender until smooth.
Serve and enjoy

meals.name: Cauliflower Rice
meals.instruction: Cut cauliflower into large florets. Rice cauliflower using shredding blade on food processor. Or pulse cauliflower in food processor with chopping blade, or grate by hand on box grater. Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add cauliflower rice and saut� until just cooked through, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste

meals.name: Red Lentil & Squash Curry Stew
meals.instruction:
1. In a large pot, add olive oil, chopped onion and minced
garlic. Saute for about 5 minutes over low-medium heat.
2. Stir in curry powder and cook another couple minutes.
Add broth and lentils and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and
cook for 10 minutes.
3. Stir in cooked butternut squash and greens of choice.
Cook over medium heat for about 5-8 minutes.
4. Season with salt, pepper, and add some freshly grated
ginger to taste.

meals.name: Clean Eating Cobb Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Wash and dry spinach then chop into pieces
2. Add eggs to a pot and cover with cold water by 1 inch.
Bring water and eggs to a rolling boil at medium/high heat
for about 8-10 minutes. Remove eggs from heat, drain and
cool in ice water and peel
3. Crumble cheese with hands, cut cherry tomatoes in half
or leave full if they are bite size
4. Cook turkey bacon by placing strips on a skillet and turn
every 2-3 minutes, adjusting heat if necessary for about
8-10 minutes until bacon reaches your desired crisp.
Transfer strips using tongs to a paper-towel lined plate to
absorb some of the excess oil. Cut bacon into bite size
pieces for salad
5. Combine salad ingredients in a large bowl.
6. separate 1 large egg yolk in a separate large bowl, whisk
7. Blend egg yolk, mustard, salt, lemon juice, pepper in a
food processor or blender until smooth. Slowly add oil until
emulsified.
8. Add all salad ingredients together, drizzle with dressing.
Serve and enjoy!

Notes:
For additional protein
add cooked chicken breast strips to this recipe
for a vegetarian option add your choice of cooked beans
For additional nutrients
add more of your favorite raw vegetables cut into bite size pieces

ingredients.name: Carrots (scrubbed and thinly sliced on the bias)
Kelp Noodles, uncooked (cut into 4-inch lengths and rinsed)
Green onion, scallion, ramp (green parts only, thinly sliced)

meals.name: Tempeh, Vegetable, and Kelp Noodle Stir-Fry
meals.instruction:
1. In a 10-inch skillet, warm 1 tablespoon of the sesame oil
over medium-high heat until simmering.
2. Add the tempeh and cook until browned, about 2
minutes, then flip and cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes.
Transfer to a plate.
3. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons sesame oil to the skillet
and heat until simmering. Add the onion, carrot, broccoli,
and cabbage and cook, stirring occasionally, until the
vegetables are slightly softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in the
ginger, stock, tamari, and tempeh, then remove pan from
the heat
4. While the tempeh and vegetables cook, in a medium
saucepan, bring 4 cups filtered water to a simmer over
medium-high heat. Add the kelp noodles and cook just until
heated through, about 3 minutes. Drain noodles in a
colander.
5. Add the noodles to the skillet, return the skillet to
medium-high heat, and toss until the noodles are well
combined with the tempeh and vegetables.
6. Toss in the scallion greens and serve.

avoid clumping
2. Add the cacao, cherries and stevia (optional) and mix
well
3. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, and stir well before
enjoying the fruits of your labor!

meals.name: Garlic and Herb Stuffed Mushrooms
meals.instruction:
1. Wipe the mushrooms with a damp towel. Do not
rinse the mushrooms under running water, they will
absorb too much water.
2. Remove the mushroom stems, trim their tough base,
and chop into a fine dice.
3. In a mortar, pound together the garlic, 1/4 tsp of
salt, and Provence herbs to form a rough paste.
4. Transfer the paste to a large bowl and stir in the
lemon juice, olive oil, and parsley.
5. Add the mushrooms and mix with a spoon to cover
the mushrooms with the marinade sauce.
6. Set aside and let the mushrooms marinate for 20
minutes at room temperature.
7. Preheat the oven to 400�F. Arrange the mushrooms
in a baking dish.
8. Add the finely diced stems to the leftover marinade
sauce, mix well and fill each of the mushrooms with
it.
9. Add a little drizzle of olive oil and a pinch of salt.
10. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, until they are nicely
brown. Serve hot.

ingredients.name: Sauerkraut (up to 1 tbsp for lunch & dinner to support gut flora & digestion of the food you are eating.)

meals.name: Sauerkraut
meals.instruction: Buy sauerkraut or other fermented veggies that contains only water, sea salt & spices/herbs. NO VINEGAR

meals.name: Tabbouleh Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Rinse and chop herbs
2. Dice onion, tomato and cucumber
3. Dress with lemon, olive oil and salt
4. Store in a tightly sealed container for freshness
throughout the week

meals.name: Honey Mustard Turkey Spinach Sandwich
meals.instruction:
Spread the mashed avocado on one side of each slice of
Ezekiel bread. 
Drizzle 1 tbsp of low fat honey mustard dressing.
Place the oven roasted turkey on 1 slice of bread.
Top with spinach, tomato, cucumber and sprouts. 
Close the sandwich, serve and enjoy.

ingredients.name: Tuna, albacore, flaked, canned in water

meals.name: White Bean + Tuna Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Empty can of white beans and tuna into a medium
salad bowl.
2. Slice the celery, green onion and kale and add to
bowl.
3. In a smaller bowl mix the garlic, lemon juice, salt,
ground pepper and olive oil. Whisk well until
incorporated.
4. Drizzle dressing on the salad and mix well and
serve. 
Enjoy!

meals.name: Quinoa Stir Fry
meals.instruction:
1. Heat oven 425 F.
2 Slice zucchini, bell peppers, red onion and delicata squash
into even-sized pieces.
3. Coat baking sheets in olive oil and arrange vegetables on
baking sheets. Place in the oven to roast- about 15-20
minutes.
4. Heat oil in a large pan over a medium-high heat. Add
ginger and garlic to the pan and cook, stirring, for 30
seconds.
5. Add cooked quinoa, tamari and peas and stir, cooking for
2 minutes. Add spinach and other roasted vegetables and
cook for another 2 minutes.
6. Fry an egg for each bowl, if desired. Fill bowls with fried
quinoa and top with scallions, red pepper flakes and an egg.
To fry an egg:
Place a pan on the stove over medium heat
Add some coconut oil and allow it to get warm
Cook the egg until the clear edges turn white
Flip the egg and allow to cook for an additional 2
minutes or longer depending on your desired texture
of yolk
Serve!
Serve and enjoy!

meals.name: Low-carb blueberry smoothie
meals.instruction:
1. Place all ingredients in a blender and mix until
smooth. Using canned coconut milk makes a
creamier, more satisfying smoothie.
2. Taste, and add more lemon juice if desired.

meals.name: Cucumber, Red Pepper, Broccoli and Hummus
meals.instruction:
1. Slice vegetables and pack away in a container with
hummus on the side. Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Cauliflower (trimmed and cut into 2- inch floreta )

meals.name: Smoky Cauliflower Hummus
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 450�. Put cauliflower florets in a large bowl
and add 1 1/2 tbsp. oil, 1 tsp. paprika, 1/2 tsp. salt, the
cumin, chile flakes, and garlic. Toss to coat thoroughly.
Spread florets evenly on a large rimmed baking sheet and
roast, stirring once, until florets are cooked through and a
little crispy, 18 to 20 minutes. Let cool.
Put 1/2 cup water in a blender with roasted cauliflower and
garlic, lemon juice, remaining 3 tbsp. oil, the tahini, and
remaining 1 1/2 tsp. salt. Blend, adding more water if
needed (up to 1/4 cup) and scraping sides often, until you
have a creamy pur�e, about 4 minutes. Taste and add more
salt or lemon juice if you like.
Spoon into a serving bowl and sprinkle with a pinch of
smoked paprika.
Make ahead: Up to 3 days, chilled airtight.
Note: 1 serving is 2 tablespoons

meals.name: Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 450F.
2. Wash, scrub and dry the sweet potatoes.
3. Place a drying rack on top of a cookie sheet and put the
sweet potatoes on top. By baking on a rack, no part of the
skin will get soggy which will make stuffing them easier.
Bake for approximately an hour turning every 20 minutes.
(The sweet potatoes are done when they are soft to the
touch and just starting to puff up, so you can tell the flesh is
shifting away from the skin.)
4. Remove from the oven and let cool enough to handle,
about 15 minutes.
5. Using a sharp knife gently slice away the top third of the
sweet potato. With a small spoon carefully scoop away the
inside of the sweet potato and put the flesh into a medium
bowl.
6. Mash the flesh with a fork and whip in cumin, coriander,
salt and a generous amount of freshly ground pepper. Mix in
the scallions, black beans and lime juice.
7. Divide the mixture in half and carefully stuff back into the
potato skins, you can overfill them as long as they can stay
upright.
8. Place potatoes back on the rack and bake for another 15
minutes.
9. Serve hot and enjoy

meals.name: Chicken Breast with Shaved Brussels Sprouts
meals.instruction:
Place chicken and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a small saucepan
and cover with water; bring to a boil. Immediately remove
from heat, cover, and let stand 15 minutes. Drain chicken
and run under cold water. Cool completely; set aside. Using
2 forks, shred into bite-size pieces; reserve.
Meanwhile, use a vegetable peeler to remove outer layer of
broccoli stems; discard. Continue peeling stems into long
strips. In a large bowl, whisk together oil, lemon juice, and
1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Add broccoli strips,
Brussels sprouts, celery, hazelnuts, parsley, and reserved
chicken to bowl with dressing; toss. Divide among bowls.
Top with cheese.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients.name: Extra virgin olive oil (or coconut oil)

meals.name: Kale and Eggs
meals.instruction:
Wash kale in cold water and remove stems.
Whisk the eggs in a bowl with the almond milk.
In pan, warm 2 tbs of oil on medium heat. Toss in the kale;
stir; cover, and let cook for 1-2 minutes.
Uncover and stir kale, pushing it over to side of the pan,
making room for your eggs.
Stir and scramble eggs continuously until cooked. Feel free
to mix the kale into the egg scramble, or keep them
separate. Salt and pepper to your taste.
Serve with your favourite salsa and/or fresh avocado.

fibers of the kale break down.
Toss with the red onion and cucumber.

meals.name: Flaxseed Paleo Tortilla Chips and Taco Shells
meals.instruction:
Preheat your oven to 175�C/350�F, using a convection
setting if you have one.
Preheat a skillet to medium high heat.
Mix together the flaxseed meal, water, and salt in the
preheated skillet using a spatula to immediately combine
the ingredients and push them together into a dough ball.
The heat of the skillet helps to make the dough less sticky
and more workable, so it's a good idea to use the spatula to
help work the dough in the skillet for around a minute
before forming it into a ball and using it.
With the help of two parchment sheets or sheets of wax
paper, roll the dough into a very thin sheet. Make it as thin
as possible so that it will crisp up quickly in the oven
without getting air bubbles.
Once the dough has been rolled thinly, cut it into tortilla
chip shapes cut the dough into round/oval shapes first and
then use a pizza cutter to cut each circle into 8 triangles.
Bake in the oven for 8-12 minutes, checking the dough
periodically for crispness.
Once crispy, remove from the oven and serve with
guacamole or homemade salsa.

meals.name: Crazy Kale Salad
meals.instruction:

meals.name: Spiced Carrot Soup
meals.instruction:
Saut� onion with coconut oil, ginger and turmeric.
Meanwhile, chop carrots into inch thick slices. Add veggie
stock and carrots and bring to a boil. Cover and let simmer
for 5-15 minutes, depending on the thickness of your
carrots. With a fork, test that they are fully cooked through
and remove from heat. Add coconut milk and spices and
blend until smooth.

ingredients.name: Fennel (trimmed and cut into thin wedges)

meals.name: Smoked Trout and Roasted Fennel Cauliflower Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 200�C (400�F).
2. Spread the cauliflower onto a medium baking tray. Drizzle
with olive oil, scatter with the cumin seeds and season with
salt and pepper. Toss to coat.
3. Spread the fennel onto a separate medium baking tray.
Drizzle with olive oil. Roast the cauliflower and fennel,
tossing occasionally, for 20-25 minutes, until tender and
golden brown. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool.
4. Meanwhile to prepare the maple almonds, line a small
baking tray with baking paper.
5. Cook the almonds in a small frying pan over medium-low
heat, tossing occasionally, until lightly roasted. Add the
maple syrup and salt. Cook, tossing to coat, until the maple
syrup has reduced to a thick sticky caramel. Pour onto the
prepared tray and set aside to cool.
6. To prepare the dressing, whisk the lemon juice, mustard,
and garlic together in a small bowl. Gradually pour in the
extra-virgin olive oil, continuously whisking, until fully
incorporated. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
7. Remove and discard the trout skin. Flake the trout into
bite-sized pieces, ensuring all the bones have been
removed. Set aside. Remove and discard the flesh of the
preserved lemon. Thinly slice the skin lengthways into
strips. Once cooled, coarsely chop the almonds.
8. Combine the cauliflower, fennel, maple almonds, trout,
preserved lemon, watercress, and parsley in a large bowl.
Toss to combine. Pour over the dressing and toss to coat.
Transfer to a large serving dish. Serve immediately.

meals.name: Salmon with Roasted Cherry Tomatoes
meals.instruction:
In bowl, combine tomatoes, thyme, garlic, oil and pepper.
Spray baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. Spread
tomato mixture in dish. Bake in 400� F (200� C) oven for 10
minutes.
Add fish; bake for 10 minutes longer or until fish flakes
easily with fork.
Serve fish topped with tomato mixture. Drizzle with lemon
juice.

ingredients.name: Chicken thighs, with skin (Organic if available)

meals.name: Smoked Paprika & Turmeric Roast Chicken Thighs
meals.instruction:
Make marinade: Add olive oil, lime juice, ginger, turmeric,
garlic, smoked paprika, salt and sumac and whisk until
everything is combined.
Wash chicken and pat dry and put in a Ziploc bag, add all of
the marinade, close bag and massage until every piece of
chicken is covered with the marinade. Put chicken in the
fridge and let marinate for at least 24 hours.
Next day:
Pre-heat oven to 350�F and line a deep baking dish with
parchment paper. Pour the chicken plus marinade into the
baking sheet and bake for 2 hours
uncovered. When cooked remove from baking dish and put
on a serving platter, drizzle some of the pan juices on the
chicken thighs & and serve with your side of choice such as
Quinoa OR Rice�..YUMMY.

ingredients.name: Partly skimmed milk, 2% M.F. (or unsweetened soy milk)

meals.name: Savory Spinach Steel Cut Oatmeal
meals.instruction:
1. In a pot on the stove, bring milk and water to a boil
over high heat. Add steel-cut oats and return to a
boil.
2. Reduce the heat to low and stir ever couple of
minutes- it should barely bubble. Simmer for 20-25
minutes, until the oats are tender and creamy but
still have a bit of a bite.
3. Chop the spinach a bit and add it to the pot along
with the sea salt or Herbamere. Give everything a
stir and let the spinach wilt for a few minutes while
you prepare the eggs.
4. Fry your eggs to your liking and slice up the grape
tomatoes.
5. Assemble bowls by portioning � of the oat mixture
into a bowl, topping it with a fried egg, sliced
tomatoes, and a sprinkle of hemp hearts.

ingredients.name: Red bell pepper (for a fun and beautiful look, use 1/4 each of orange, yellow, purple, red peppers)

meals.name: One-Pan Roasted Chicken and Veggies
meals.instruction:
Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Step 2: Chop all the veggies into large cubed pieces,
making sure all sizes are similar.
Step 3: Chop the chicken into cubes.
Step 4: Place the chicken and veggies in a large mixing
bowl. Add the olive oil, salt and pepper, Italian seasoning,
and paprika. Toss to combine.
Step 5: Empty contents from the mixing bowl onto a large
sheet pan, or two if needed.
Step 6: Bake for 15 - 20 minutes or until the veggies are
charred and chicken is cooked through.
Step 7: Enjoy over, or with a side of rice, pasta, quinoa,
etc.

meals.name: Nourish Dust
meals.instruction:
Directions: In a high powered blender, grind chia/flax,
sunflower and pumpkin seeds until a fine powder is made.
Add hemp hearts and powder mixture to a mason jar and
store in the fridge for up to 1 month.
Spices to Season: all spice, anise, cardamom, cinnamon,
clove, ginger, nutmeg
Uses: sprinkle on top of an apple with a touch of sea salt
and lemon; add to guacomole, add to smoothies, atop
salads or sprinkle on yogurt/oatmeal/hot cereals!
Note: 1 serving is 1 tablespoon

ingredients.name:
Lime juice (add zest too for more lime
flavour)

meals.name: Cauliflower Tortillas for a Deliciously Happy Bell
meals.instruction:
Preheat the oven to 375�F, put on a pot to steam the
cauliflower in a steam basket, and line a baking sheet with
parchment paper.
Trim the cauliflower, small chunks & then steam them for
2-3 minutes so soft, but not mushy.
Let the cauliflower cool and then pulse it in a food processor
in batches until you get a couscous-like consistency. The
finely riced cauliflower should make about 2 cups packed.
Place the cauliflower Place the cauliflower in a fine
cheesecloth or thin dishtowel and squeeze out as much
liquid as possible,
In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs (or chia egg for vegans).
Add in cauliflower, cilantro, lime, sea salt, and black pepper.
Mix until well combined.
Use your hands to shape six small "tortillas" on the
parchment paper.
Bake for 10 minutes, carefully flip each tortilla and return to
the oven for an additional 5 to 7 minutes, or until
completely set. Place tortillas on a wire rack to cool slightly.
Heat a medium-sized skillet on medium. Place a baked
tortilla in the pan, pressing down slightly, and brown for 1 to
2 minutes on each side. Repeat with remaining tortillas.
Tip: You can munch these by themselves, make quesadillas
with them, or add some taco filling and fold it like a taco

2. Slice the celery, green onion and kale and add to

incorporated.
4. Drizzle dressing on the salad and mix well and
serve. 
Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F and position a rack in the center of the oven. In a large mixing bowl, combine the coconut, nuts, chia seeds, flax seed, cinnamon, coconut sugar, and salt. In a small saucepan over low heat, warm the coconut oil and pour over the dry ingredients and mix well. Spread the mixture evenly onto a large baking sheet (may require two depending on size) and bake for 20 minutes. Then remove from oven, add roasted sunflower seeds and stir. Increase heat to 340 degrees and return to oven for another 5-8 minutes, or until deep golden brown. The coconut oil will help this granola crisp up nicely, but be sure to watch it carefully as it browns quickly. Once the granola is visibly browned and done cooking (about 27 minutes total for me), remove from the oven and let cool completely. Store in a container with an air-tight seal and it should keep for a few weeks

meals.name: Chicken Breast with Shaved Brussels Sprouts
meals.instruction:
Place chicken and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a small saucepan
and cover with water; bring to a boil. Immediately remove
from heat, cover, and let stand 15 minutes. Drain chicken
and run under cold water. Cool completely; set aside. Using
2 forks, shred into bite-size pieces; reserve.
Meanwhile, use a vegetable peeler to remove outer layer of
broccoli stems; discard. Continue peeling stems into long
strips. In a large bowl, whisk together oil, lemon juice, and
1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Add broccoli strips,
Brussels sprouts, celery, hazelnuts, parsley, and reserved
chicken to bowl with dressing; toss. Divide among bowls.
Top with cheese.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients.name: Extra virgin olive oil (for cilantro sauce)

meals.name: The Turkey Quinoa Veggie Bowl
meals.instruction:
Start by browning turkey meat and set aside. Using the
same pan cook the quinoa. Bring 2 cups water to a boil,
then add quinoa. Simmer for about 15 minutes until all
water is absorbed. When done, remove from heat and keep
covered for about 10 minutes so quinoa can absorb any
excess water.
Preheat oven to 425. In a bowl, toss chickpeas, oil, and
spices until chickpeas are evenly coated. On a baking sheet
lined with parchment paper, bake chickpeas for 15 minutes.
When done, remove from oven and let cool.
To make the cilantro carrot dressing, chop the carrots into
smaller pieces before blending, add all dressing ingredients
to a blender and blend until smooth.
Finally, assemble the bowls. In two bowls, add quinoa, baby
spinach, and chickpeas. Drizzle everything with cilantro
carrot sauce, and sprinkle with sunflower seeds.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name: White onion (chopped finely in a food processor)

meals.name: CAULIFLOWER RICE
meals.instruction:
chop cauliflower & place in Cuisinart food processor
I pulsed the contents until they were reduced to the size of
couscous or rice grains. 
Then, I sauteed the onions in the melted butter and coconut
oil over medium heat until they were translucent. 
When the onions were softened, I dumped in the cauliflower
and stirred everything around to evenly distribute the fat
and onions. 
I seasoned the �rice� with some Aleppo chile finishing salt
and pepper. 
Then, I covered the skillet and cooked the cauliflower for
5-10 minutes until softened. I tasted for seasoning and
added some Trader Joe�s 21 seasoning salute and additional
salt and pepper.

ingredients.name: Partly skimmed milk, 2% M.F. (or unsweetened soy milk)

meals.name: Savory Spinach Steel Cut Oatmeal
meals.instruction:
1. In a pot on the stove, bring milk and water to a boil
over high heat. Add steel-cut oats and return to a
boil.
2. Reduce the heat to low and stir ever couple of
minutes- it should barely bubble. Simmer for 20-25
minutes, until the oats are tender and creamy but
still have a bit of a bite.
3. Chop the spinach a bit and add it to the pot along
with the sea salt or Herbamere. Give everything a
stir and let the spinach wilt for a few minutes while
you prepare the eggs.
4. Fry your eggs to your liking and slice up the grape
tomatoes.
5. Assemble bowls by portioning � of the oat mixture
into a bowl, topping it with a fried egg, sliced
tomatoes, and a sprinkle of hemp hearts.

smooth. Using canned coconut milk makes a
creamier, more satisfying smoothie.

meals.name: Spring Dump Tea
meals.instruction: Pour 2 cup of freshly boiled water over herbs in a steeping tea pot. Steep 15 minutes with a lid (keeping all the volatile oils in infusion). Strain and enjoy. You may add 1/2 tsp honey for flavour. Enjoy hot or poured over ice with lemon.

meals.name: Toasted Almonds
meals.instruction: 1. Enjoy as a snack in between meals.

meals.instruction:
1. Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until
smooth.

ingredients.name: Fennel (trimmed and cut into thin wedges)

meals.name: Smoked Trout and Roasted Fennel Cauliflower Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 200�C (400�F).
2. Spread the cauliflower onto a medium baking tray. Drizzle
with olive oil, scatter with the cumin seeds and season with
salt and pepper. Toss to coat.
3. Spread the fennel onto a separate medium baking tray.
Drizzle with olive oil. Roast the cauliflower and fennel,
tossing occasionally, for 20-25 minutes, until tender and
golden brown. Remove from the oven and set aside to cool.
4. Meanwhile to prepare the maple almonds, line a small
baking tray with baking paper.
5. Cook the almonds in a small frying pan over medium-low
heat, tossing occasionally, until lightly roasted. Add the
maple syrup and salt. Cook, tossing to coat, until the maple
syrup has reduced to a thick sticky caramel. Pour onto the
prepared tray and set aside to cool.
6. To prepare the dressing, whisk the lemon juice, mustard,
and garlic together in a small bowl. Gradually pour in the
extra-virgin olive oil, continuously whisking, until fully
incorporated. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
7. Remove and discard the trout skin. Flake the trout into
bite-sized pieces, ensuring all the bones have been
removed. Set aside. Remove and discard the flesh of the
preserved lemon. Thinly slice the skin lengthways into
strips. Once cooled, coarsely chop the almonds.
8. Combine the cauliflower, fennel, maple almonds, trout,
preserved lemon, watercress, and parsley in a large bowl.
Toss to combine. Pour over the dressing and toss to coat.
Transfer to a large serving dish. Serve immediately.

ingredients.name: Avocado oil (divided between salmon and veggies)
Garlic powder (to taste, divided between veggies and salmon)

meals.name: One Pan Roasted Salmon and Veggies
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Prepare veggies, add to a bowl and toss in half of the oil
and seasonings.
Add a small amount of oil to the pan where you want to add
salmon and then add salmon to pan, then add the rest of
the oil and seasonings to the top of the salmon.
Place veggies around salmon and place in pre heated oven.
Cook for 20-30 minutes; shaking or flipping vegetables half
way through. Ready to eat out of the oven. Serve on a bed
of your choice of greens or with cauliflower rice or a small
side 1/2 cup or less of rice of choice.

meals.name: Choco-Cherry Chia Bowl
meals.instruction:
1. Using a fork, stir the chia seeds and milk for 2 minutes to
avoid clumping
2. Add the cacao, cherries and stevia (optional) and mix
well
3. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, and stir well before
enjoying the fruits of your labor!

meals.name: Zucchini Chips
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 225 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. Line two large baking sheets with silicon baking mats or
parchment paper.
3. Slice your zucchini on a mandolin to desired thickness.
4. After you slice your zucchini, place the slices on a sheet
of paper towels and take another paper towel and sandwich
the zucchini slices and press on them. This helps draw out
the liquid so it will cook a bit faster.
5. Line up the zucchini slices on the prepared baking sheet
tightly next to each other in a straight line, making sure not
to overlap them.
6. In a small bowl, pour your olive oil in and take a pastry
brush to brush the olive oil on each zucchini slice.
Sprinkle salt throughout the baking sheet. Be careful not to
over-season, in fact, it's better to use less salt initially
because the slices will shrink.
7. Bake for 2+ hours until they start to brown and are crisp.
8. Let cool before removing and serving. Keep in an airtight
container for no more than 3 days.

meals.name: Emerald Kale Salad
meals.instruction:
Put chopped kale into a large bowl, drizzle with olive oil and
sprinkle with sea salt.
Massage gently with hands for 5-10 minutes, until the tough
fibers of the kale break down.
Toss with the red onion and cucumber.

meals.name: Smoky Cauliflower Hummus
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 450�. Put cauliflower florets in a large bowl
and add 1 1/2 tbsp. oil, 1 tsp. paprika, 1/2 tsp. salt, the
cumin, chile flakes, and garlic. Toss to coat thoroughly.
Spread florets evenly on a large rimmed baking sheet and
roast, stirring once, until florets are cooked through and a
little crispy, 18 to 20 minutes. Let cool.
Put 1/2 cup water in a blender with roasted cauliflower and
garlic, lemon juice, remaining 3 tbsp. oil, the tahini, and
remaining 1 1/2 tsp. salt. Blend, adding more water if
needed (up to 1/4 cup) and scraping sides often, until you
have a creamy pur�e, about 4 minutes. Taste and add more
salt or lemon juice if you like.
Spoon into a serving bowl and sprinkle with a pinch of
smoked paprika.
Make ahead: Up to 3 days, chilled airtight.
Note: 1 serving is 2 tablespoons

meals.name: Flaxseed Paleo Tortilla Chips and Taco Shells
meals.instruction:
Preheat your oven to 175�C/350�F, using a convection
setting if you have one.
Preheat a skillet to medium high heat.
Mix together the flaxseed meal, water, and salt in the
preheated skillet using a spatula to immediately combine
the ingredients and push them together into a dough ball.
The heat of the skillet helps to make the dough less sticky
and more workable, so it's a good idea to use the spatula to
help work the dough in the skillet for around a minute
before forming it into a ball and using it.
With the help of two parchment sheets or sheets of wax
paper, roll the dough into a very thin sheet. Make it as thin
as possible so that it will crisp up quickly in the oven
without getting air bubbles.
Once the dough has been rolled thinly, cut it into tortilla
chip shapes cut the dough into round/oval shapes first and
then use a pizza cutter to cut each circle into 8 triangles.
Bake in the oven for 8-12 minutes, checking the dough
periodically for crispness.
Once crispy, remove from the oven and serve with
guacamole or homemade salsa.

ingredients.name: Quinoa, cooked (cook with vegetable broth for more flavour)
Leek (finely chopped, light green and white parts only)

meals.name: Butternut, Carrot & Leek Quiche with Quinoa Crust
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 (F). Grease a 9 inch tart pan with coconut oil (or oil of choice).
2. For the crust:
Combine the flax and water in a small bowl and set aside to thicken.
Stir together the cooked quinoa, nutritional yeast, coconut oil, and herbs.
Add the flax mixture and mix until well combined.
Press the mixture into prepared tart pan using your hands.
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden.
Turn the oven heat down to 350 (F).
3.For the filling:
In a large pan, heat coconut oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, leeks, carrots, and butternut squash.
Saut�, stirring frequently, until carrots and squash are tender (about 8-10 minutes).
Add spinach and stir until wilted. Remove pan from heat.
In a food processor, combine the remaining ingredients until very smooth.
Transfer creamy mixture to a bowl and stir in saut�ed veggies. Spread the filling over the prepared crust and bake for about
35 minutes (the top should be golden).
Garnish with fresh sage. Allow to cool for at least 10 minutes before slicing.
Enjoy!

meals.instruction: Cut cauliflower into large florets. Rice cauliflower using shredding blade on food processor. Or pulse cauliflower in food processor with chopping blade, or grate by hand on box grater. Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add cauliflower rice and saut� until just cooked through, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste

ingredients.name: Green onion, scallion, ramp (thinly sliced; for sauce)
Ginger root (peeled & very finely minced - a microplane works great; for sauce)
Tamari, gluten free, reduced sodium (for sauce)

meals.name: Buckwheat Soba Noodle Salad
meals.instruction:
Instructions
1. Cook soba noodles according to package instructions,
drain and rinse with cold water.
3. Toss noodles with half the scallion sauce and half the
cilantro, cucumber, carrot, and bok choy.
4. Put in a serving bowl, scatter with the remaining
ingredients, and drizzle more ginger scallion sauce over the
top.
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Green onion, scallion, ramp
1/4 bunch 
Instructions:
For the ginger scallion sauce, combine green
onion, ginger root, sesame oil, tamari, rice vinegar,
grape seed oil and coconut sugar in a small bowl
and let sit while you prepare the salad. Store in
fridge until ready to use.

meals.name: Nourish Dust
meals.instruction:
Directions: In a high powered blender, grind chia/flax,
sunflower and pumpkin seeds until a fine powder is made.
Add hemp hearts and powder mixture to a mason jar and
store in the fridge for up to 1 month.
Spices to Season: all spice, anise, cardamom, cinnamon,
clove, ginger, nutmeg
Uses: sprinkle on top of an apple with a touch of sea salt
and lemon; add to guacomole, add to smoothies, atop
salads or sprinkle on yogurt/oatmeal/hot cereals!
Note: 1 serving is 1 tablespoon

meals.name: Carrot Cake Energy Bites
meals.instruction:
1. Combine all the ingredients in the food processor and
pulse until combined.
2. Place in fridge for 30 minutes to firm slightly and then roll
into one inch balls.
3. Roll in unsweetened coconut and keep in an air tight
container in the refrigerator for up to one week.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Hemp protein powder (optional - any protein powder of choice)
Almond milk, chocolate, unsweetened, Blue Diamond

meals.name: Chocolate Almond Butter Shake
meals.instruction:
1. Combine protein powder, almond milk almond butter,
blueberries and chia seeds in a high powered blender and
blend until smooth and creamy.
2. Add 1-2 ice cubes for more of an 'iced' shake! Serve
immediately.

Parsley, Italian, fresh (tightly packed; for Paleo Pesto)
Capers, canned (rinsed and drained; for Paleo Pesto)
Extra virgin olive oil (for Paleo Pesto)

meals.name: Italian Sausage + Kale Casserole
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 400�F with the rack in the middle. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons cooking fat to the pan when it�s hot.
2. Grease a 9 x 13 casserole pan with the remaining � tablespoon of fat.
3. Toss the onions, carrots, and mushrooms into the skillet. Cook until the moisture has evaporated from the mushrooms and the vegetables have softened, about 5 to 7 minutes.
4. Season the veggies with about 1 teaspoon of Magic Mushroom Powder (or salt) and a sprinkle of pepper. Stir to incorporate and then transfer to the greased baking pan.
5. Decrease the heat to medium, and add the sausage to the now-empty skillet. Break up the meat with a spatula. Cook, over medium heat, stirring, for 5 to 7 minutes or until it�s no longer pink.
6. Add the kale and stir to combine. Saut� until the greens are wilted, about 2-3 minutes.
7. Stir in the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant.
8. Pour in the marinara sauce and add the oregano. Season to taste with another � teaspoon of Magic Mushroom Powder or with salt and pepper. Stir well to incorporate.
9. Transfer the sausage mixture to the ingredients in the casserole pan.
10. Pour in the whisked eggs to the casserole pan and stir to combine. Smooth the top of the casserole with a spatula.
11. Put the casserole in the oven and bake for 25-30 minutes or until the eggs are set and browned on the edges.
12. Rest the casserole for 5-10 minutes, and then slice and serve. Extras can be refrigerated for up to 4 days or frozen for up to 4 months.

Paleo Pesto (see 'Notes' below for original recipe)
In a food processor or blender, combine the arugula, parsley, almonds, capers, garlic cloves, and lemon juice. Pulse until
finely chopped, scraping the sides down if needed.
Then, while the food processor is running, pour the olive oil through the feed tube.
Process until smooth (or your desired chunkiness). Season to taste with salt and pepper.

meals.name: Spiced Carrot Soup
meals.instruction:
Saut� onion with coconut oil, ginger and turmeric.
Meanwhile, chop carrots into inch thick slices. Add veggie
stock and carrots and bring to a boil. Cover and let simmer
for 5-15 minutes, depending on the thickness of your
carrots. With a fork, test that they are fully cooked through
and remove from heat. Add coconut milk and spices and
blend until smooth.

1. Heat oven 425 F.
2 Slice zucchini, bell peppers, red onion and delicata squash

3. Coat baking sheets in olive oil and arrange vegetables on
baking sheets. Place in the oven to roast- about 15-20
minutes.
4. Heat oil in a large pan over a medium-high heat. Add
ginger and garlic to the pan and cook, stirring, for 30

5. Add cooked quinoa, tamari and peas and stir, cooking for
2 minutes. Add spinach and other roasted vegetables and
cook for another 2 minutes.
6. Fry an egg for each bowl, if desired. Fill bowls with fried
quinoa and top with scallions, red pepper flakes and an egg.
To fry an egg:
Place a pan on the stove over medium heat
Add some coconut oil and allow it to get warm
Cook the egg until the clear edges turn white
Flip the egg and allow to cook for an additional 2
minutes or longer depending on your desired texture
of yolk
Serve!
Serve and enjoy!

meals.name: Blueberry, Almond and Feta Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Combine romaine, blueberries, cucumber, feta and
almonds in a large bowl.
2. Whisk together Dijon mustard, balsamic vinegar,
maple syrup and salt. Slowly pour in olive oil
whisking until completely combined and emulsified.
3. Portion the salad and top with 1�2 tablespoons of
dressing

ingredients.name: Green onion, scallion, ramp (thinly sliced; for sauce)
Ginger root (peeled & very finely minced - a microplane works great; for sauce)
Tamari, gluten free, reduced sodium (for sauce)

meals.name: Buckwheat Soba Noodle Salad
meals.instruction:
Instructions
1. Cook soba noodles according to package instructions,
drain and rinse with cold water.
3. Toss noodles with half the scallion sauce and half the
cilantro, cucumber, carrot, and bok choy.
4. Put in a serving bowl, scatter with the remaining
ingredients, and drizzle more ginger scallion sauce over the
top.
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Green onion, scallion, ramp
1/4 bunch 
Instructions:
For the ginger scallion sauce, combine green
onion, ginger root, sesame oil, tamari, rice vinegar,
grape seed oil and coconut sugar in a small bowl
and let sit while you prepare the salad. Store in
fridge until ready to use.

ingredients.name: Cauliflower (trimmed and cut into 2- inch floreta )

meals.name: Smoky Cauliflower Hummus
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 450�. Put cauliflower florets in a large bowl
and add 1 1/2 tbsp. oil, 1 tsp. paprika, 1/2 tsp. salt, the
cumin, chile flakes, and garlic. Toss to coat thoroughly.
Spread florets evenly on a large rimmed baking sheet and
roast, stirring once, until florets are cooked through and a
little crispy, 18 to 20 minutes. Let cool.
Put 1/2 cup water in a blender with roasted cauliflower and
garlic, lemon juice, remaining 3 tbsp. oil, the tahini, and
remaining 1 1/2 tsp. salt. Blend, adding more water if
needed (up to 1/4 cup) and scraping sides often, until you
have a creamy pur�e, about 4 minutes. Taste and add more
salt or lemon juice if you like.
Spoon into a serving bowl and sprinkle with a pinch of
smoked paprika.
Make ahead: Up to 3 days, chilled airtight.
Note: 1 serving is 2 tablespoons

meals.name: Chicken Breast with Shaved Brussels Sprouts
meals.instruction:
Place chicken and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a small saucepan
and cover with water; bring to a boil. Immediately remove
from heat, cover, and let stand 15 minutes. Drain chicken
and run under cold water. Cool completely; set aside. Using
2 forks, shred into bite-size pieces; reserve.
Meanwhile, use a vegetable peeler to remove outer layer of
broccoli stems; discard. Continue peeling stems into long
strips. In a large bowl, whisk together oil, lemon juice, and
1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Add broccoli strips,
Brussels sprouts, celery, hazelnuts, parsley, and reserved
chicken to bowl with dressing; toss. Divide among bowls.
Top with cheese.
Serve and enjoy!

meals.name: Spiced Carrot Soup
meals.instruction:
Saut� onion with coconut oil, ginger and turmeric.
Meanwhile, chop carrots into inch thick slices. Add veggie
stock and carrots and bring to a boil. Cover and let simmer
for 5-15 minutes, depending on the thickness of your
carrots. With a fork, test that they are fully cooked through
and remove from heat. Add coconut milk and spices and
blend until smooth.

ingredients.name: Hemp protein powder (optional - any protein powder of choice)
Almond milk, chocolate, unsweetened, Blue Diamond

meals.name: Chocolate Almond Butter Shake
meals.instruction:
1. Combine protein powder, almond milk almond butter,
blueberries and chia seeds in a high powered blender and
blend until smooth and creamy.
2. Add 1-2 ice cubes for more of an 'iced' shake! Serve
immediately.

meals.name: Handful of Almonds
meals.instruction: A handful of roasted almonds makes the perfect snack.

meals.name: Spring Dump Tea
meals.instruction: Pour 2 cup of freshly boiled water over herbs in a steeping tea pot. Steep 15 minutes with a lid (keeping all the volatile oils in infusion). Strain and enjoy. You may add 1/2 tsp honey for flavour. Enjoy hot or poured over ice with lemon.

meals.name: Mixed Berries and Yogurt Smoothie
meals.instruction:
1. Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until
smooth.
Serve and enjoy!

ingredients.name: Ginger root (fresh minced; plus more to taste)

meals.name: Cherry Ginger Joy Smoothie
meals.instruction:
1. Throw all of the ingredients into your blender and
blast on high for 30-60 seconds until smooth and
creamy.

meals.name: Nourish Dust
meals.instruction:
Directions: In a high powered blender, grind chia/flax,
sunflower and pumpkin seeds until a fine powder is made.
Add hemp hearts and powder mixture to a mason jar and
store in the fridge for up to 1 month.
Spices to Season: all spice, anise, cardamom, cinnamon,
clove, ginger, nutmeg
Uses: sprinkle on top of an apple with a touch of sea salt
and lemon; add to guacomole, add to smoothies, atop
salads or sprinkle on yogurt/oatmeal/hot cereals!
Note: 1 serving is 1 tablespoon

meals.name: Zucchini Chips
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 225 degrees Fahrenheit. Line two large
baking sheets with silicon baking mats or parchment paper.
Slice your zucchini on a mandolin to desired thickness.
After you slice your zucchini, place the slices on a sheet of
paper towels and take another paper towel and sandwich
the zucchini slices and press on them. This helps draw out
the liquid so it will cook a bit faster.
Line up the zucchini slices on the prepared baking sheet
tightly next to each other in a straight line, making sure not
to overlap them.
In a small bowl, pour your olive oil in and take a pastry
brush to brush the olive oil on each zucchini slice.
Sprinkle salt throughout the baking sheet. Be careful not to
over-season, in fact, it's better to use less salt initially
because the slices will shrink.
Bake for 2+ hours until they start to brown and are crisp.
Let cool before removing and serving. Keep in an airtight
container for no more than 3 days.

meals.name: Salmon with Roasted Cherry Tomatoes
meals.instruction:
In bowl, combine tomatoes, thyme, garlic, oil and pepper.
Spray baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. Spread
tomato mixture in dish. Bake in 400� F (200� C) oven for 10
minutes.
Add fish; bake for 10 minutes longer or until fish flakes
easily with fork.
Serve fish topped with tomato mixture. Drizzle with lemon
juice.

ingredients.name: Sauerkraut (up to 1 tbsp for lunch & dinner to support gut flora & digestion of the food you are eating.)

meals.name: Sauerkraut
meals.instruction: Buy sauerkraut or other fermented veggies that contains only water, sea salt & spices/herbs. NO VINEGAR

meals.name: High Protein Cottage Cheese & Fruit Snack ( Copy )
meals.instruction:
These two ingredients make for the easiest high protein
snack to keep you feeling satisfied between meals.
Add your choice of fruits for extra fibre and sweetness!

ingredients.name: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F and position a rack in the center of the oven. In a large mixing bowl, combine the coconut, nuts, chia seeds, flax seed, cinnamon, coconut sugar, and salt. In a small saucepan over low heat, warm the coconut oil and pour over the dry ingredients and mix well. Spread the mixture evenly onto a large baking sheet (may require two depending on size) and bake for 20 minutes. Then remove from oven, add roasted sunflower seeds and stir. Increase heat to 340 degrees and return to oven for another 5-8 minutes, or until deep golden brown. The coconut oil will help this granola crisp up nicely, but be sure to watch it carefully as it browns quickly. Once the granola is visibly browned and done cooking (about 27 minutes total for me), remove from the oven and let cool completely. Store in a container with an air-tight seal and it should keep for a few weeks

meals.name: Grain Free Granola Low Carb
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F and position a rack in the
center of the oven.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the coconut, nuts, chia
seeds, flax seed, cinnamon, coconut sugar, and salt.
In a small saucepan over low heat, warm the coconut
oil and pour over the dry ingredients and mix well.
Spread the mixture evenly onto a large baking sheet (may
require two depending on size) and bake for 20 minutes.
Then remove from oven, add roasted sunflower seeds and
stir.
Increase heat to 340 degrees and return to oven for another
5-8 minutes, or until deep golden brown.
The coconut oil will help this granola crisp up nicely, but be
sure to watch it carefully as it browns quickly.
Once the granola is visibly browned and done cooking
(about 27 minutes total for me), remove from the oven and
let cool completely.
Store in a container with an air-tight seal and it should keep
for a few weeks

meals.name: Honey Mustard Turkey Spinach Sandwich
meals.instruction:
Spread the mashed avocado on one side of each slice of
Ezekiel bread. 
Drizzle 1 tbsp of low fat honey mustard dressing.
Place the oven roasted turkey on 1 slice of bread.
Top with spinach, tomato, cucumber and sprouts. 
Close the sandwich, serve and enjoy.

meals.name: Red Lentil & Squash Curry Stew
meals.instruction:
1. In a large pot, add olive oil, chopped onion and minced
garlic. Saute for about 5 minutes over low-medium heat.
2. Stir in curry powder and cook another couple minutes.
Add broth and lentils and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and
cook for 10 minutes.
3. Stir in cooked butternut squash and greens of choice.
Cook over medium heat for about 5-8 minutes.
4. Season with salt, pepper, and add some freshly grated
ginger to taste.

meals.name: Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 450F.
2. Wash, scrub and dry the sweet potatoes.
3. Place a drying rack on top of a cookie sheet and put the
sweet potatoes on top. By baking on a rack, no part of the
skin will get soggy which will make stuffing them easier.
Bake for approximately an hour turning every 20 minutes.
(The sweet potatoes are done when they are soft to the
touch and just starting to puff up, so you can tell the flesh is
shifting away from the skin.)
4. Remove from the oven and let cool enough to handle,
about 15 minutes.
5. Using a sharp knife gently slice away the top third of the
sweet potato. With a small spoon carefully scoop away the
inside of the sweet potato and put the flesh into a medium
bowl.
6. Mash the flesh with a fork and whip in cumin, coriander,
salt and a generous amount of freshly ground pepper. Mix in
the scallions, black beans and lime juice.
7. Divide the mixture in half and carefully stuff back into the
potato skins, you can overfill them as long as they can stay
upright.
8. Place potatoes back on the rack and bake for another 15
minutes.
9. Serve hot and enjoy

ingredients.name: Salmon, smoked (see notes for vegan option)

meals.name: Sweet Potato Toast with Smoked Salmon & Guacamole
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 400F degrees.
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
3. Wash sweet potato thoroughly, and then slice into 1/4"
an inch slices (you can use a mandoline slicer). These are
your sweet potato toasts.
4. Coat both sides of sweet potato toasts with olive oil and
lightly sprinkle with sea salt.
5. Bake for 30 minutes (flipping at 20 minutes). At 20
minutes, set oven to broil and continue to cook for 1-2
minutes on each side, until toasty.
6. Remove from oven and set on a plate. Top sweet potato
toasts with guacamole and smoked salmon (check notes for
vegan option).
7. Optional: you can add greens such as arugula, spinach or
sprouts for an extra nutritional boost.

ingredients.name: Olive oil (ghee; avocado oil, or your favorite cooking fat)
Kale (lacinato kale; stems removed and leaves thinly sliced)
Parsley, Italian, fresh (tightly packed; for Paleo Pesto)
Capers, canned (rinsed and drained; for Paleo Pesto)
Extra virgin olive oil (for Paleo Pesto)

meals.name: Italian Sausage + Kale Casserole
meals.instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 400�F with the rack in the middle. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons cooking fat to the pan when it�s hot.
2. Grease a 9 x 13 casserole pan with the remaining � tablespoon of fat.
3. Toss the onions, carrots, and mushrooms into the skillet. Cook until the moisture has evaporated from the mushrooms and the vegetables have softened, about 5 to 7 minutes.
4. Season the veggies with about 1 teaspoon of Magic Mushroom Powder (or salt) and a sprinkle of pepper. Stir to incorporate and then transfer to the greased baking pan.
5. Decrease the heat to medium, and add the sausage to the now-empty skillet. Break up the meat with a spatula. Cook, over medium heat, stirring, for 5 to 7 minutes or until it�s no longer pink.
6. Add the kale and stir to combine. Saut� until the greens are wilted, about 2-3 minutes.
7. Stir in the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant.
8. Pour in the marinara sauce and add the oregano. Season to taste with another � teaspoon of Magic Mushroom Powder or with salt and pepper. Stir well to incorporate.
9. Transfer the sausage mixture to the ingredients in the casserole pan.
10. Pour in the whisked eggs to the casserole pan and stir to combine. Smooth the top of the casserole with a spatula.
11. Put the casserole in the oven and bake for 25-30 minutes or until the eggs are set and browned on the edges.
12. Rest the casserole for 5-10 minutes, and then slice and serve. Extras can be refrigerated for up to 4 days or frozen for up to 4 months.

Paleo Pesto (see 'Notes' below for original recipe)
In a food processor or blender, combine the arugula, parsley, almonds, capers, garlic cloves, and lemon juice. Pulse until
finely chopped, scraping the sides down if needed.
Then, while the food processor is running, pour the olive oil through the feed tube.
Process until smooth (or your desired chunkiness). Season to taste with salt and pepper.

ingredients.name:
Lime juice (add zest too for more lime
flavour)

meals.name: Cauliflower Tortillas for a Deliciously Happy Bell
meals.instruction:
Preheat the oven to 375�F, put on a pot to steam the
cauliflower in a steam basket, and line a baking sheet with
parchment paper.
Trim the cauliflower, small chunks & then steam them for
2-3 minutes so soft, but not mushy.
Let the cauliflower cool and then pulse it in a food processor
in batches until you get a couscous-like consistency. The
finely riced cauliflower should make about 2 cups packed.
Place the cauliflower Place the cauliflower in a fine
cheesecloth or thin dishtowel and squeeze out as much
liquid as possible,
In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs (or chia egg for vegans).
Add in cauliflower, cilantro, lime, sea salt, and black pepper.
Mix until well combined.
Use your hands to shape six small "tortillas" on the
parchment paper.
Bake for 10 minutes, carefully flip each tortilla and return to
the oven for an additional 5 to 7 minutes, or until
completely set. Place tortillas on a wire rack to cool slightly.
Heat a medium-sized skillet on medium. Place a baked
tortilla in the pan, pressing down slightly, and brown for 1 to
2 minutes on each side. Repeat with remaining tortillas.
Tip: You can munch these by themselves, make quesadillas
with them, or add some taco filling and fold it like a taco

store in the fridge for up to 1 month.

meals.name: Clean Eating Cobb Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Wash and dry spinach then chop into pieces
2. Add eggs to a pot and cover with cold water by 1 inch.
Bring water and eggs to a rolling boil at medium/high heat
for about 8-10 minutes. Remove eggs from heat, drain and
cool in ice water and peel
3. Crumble cheese with hands, cut cherry tomatoes in half
or leave full if they are bite size
4. Cook turkey bacon by placing strips on a skillet and turn
every 2-3 minutes, adjusting heat if necessary for about
8-10 minutes until bacon reaches your desired crisp.
Transfer strips using tongs to a paper-towel lined plate to
absorb some of the excess oil. Cut bacon into bite size
pieces for salad
5. Combine salad ingredients in a large bowl.
6. separate 1 large egg yolk in a separate large bowl, whisk
7. Blend egg yolk, mustard, salt, lemon juice, pepper in a
food processor or blender until smooth. Slowly add oil until
emulsified.
8. Add all salad ingredients together, drizzle with dressing.
Serve and enjoy!

Notes:
For additional protein
add cooked chicken breast strips to this recipe
for a vegetarian option add your choice of cooked beans
For additional nutrients
add more of your favorite raw vegetables cut into bite size pieces

ingredients.name: Sauerkraut (up to 1 tbsp for lunch & dinner to support gut flora & digestion of the food you are eating.)

meals.name: Sauerkraut
meals.instruction: Buy sauerkraut or other fermented veggies that contains only water, sea salt & spices/herbs. NO VINEGAR

ingredients.name: Extra virgin olive oil (or coconut oil)

meals.name: Kale and Eggs
meals.instruction:
Wash kale in cold water and remove stems.
Whisk the eggs in a bowl with the almond milk.
In pan, warm 2 tbs of oil on medium heat. Toss in the kale;
stir; cover, and let cook for 1-2 minutes.
Uncover and stir kale, pushing it over to side of the pan,
making room for your eggs.
Stir and scramble eggs continuously until cooked. Feel free
to mix the kale into the egg scramble, or keep them
separate. Salt and pepper to your taste.
Serve with your favourite salsa and/or fresh avocado.

ingredients.name: Bread, sprouted, whole grain, Ezekiel (or gluten-free bread)

meals.name: Open Face Avocado & Tomato Sandwich
meals.instruction: Toast slices of bread. Meanwhile, slice tomato thinly and cut the avocado in half. Mash � the avocado on each piece of toast and arrange tomato slices on top. Grind fresh salt and pepper to taste.

ingredients.name: Carrots (scrubbed and thinly sliced on the bias)
Kelp Noodles, uncooked (cut into 4-inch lengths and rinsed)
Green onion, scallion, ramp (green parts only, thinly sliced)

meals.name: Tempeh, Vegetable, and Kelp Noodle Stir-Fry
meals.instruction:
1. In a 10-inch skillet, warm 1 tablespoon of the sesame oil
over medium-high heat until simmering.
2. Add the tempeh and cook until browned, about 2
minutes, then flip and cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes.
Transfer to a plate.
3. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons sesame oil to the skillet
and heat until simmering. Add the onion, carrot, broccoli,
and cabbage and cook, stirring occasionally, until the
vegetables are slightly softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in the
ginger, stock, tamari, and tempeh, then remove pan from
the heat
4. While the tempeh and vegetables cook, in a medium
saucepan, bring 4 cups filtered water to a simmer over
medium-high heat. Add the kelp noodles and cook just until
heated through, about 3 minutes. Drain noodles in a
colander.
5. Add the noodles to the skillet, return the skillet to
medium-high heat, and toss until the noodles are well
combined with the tempeh and vegetables.
6. Toss in the scallion greens and serve.

meals.name: Carrot Cake Energy Bites
meals.instruction:
1. Combine all the ingredients in the food processor and
pulse until combined.
2. Place in fridge for 30 minutes to firm slightly and then roll
into one inch balls.
3. Roll in unsweetened coconut and keep in an air tight
container in the refrigerator for up to one week.
Enjoy!
